>>Weather Harbin

The climatic conditions prevailing in Harbin are characterized by cold and temperate weather. During the winter season, there is a significant decrease in precipitation levels within Harbin as compared to the summer months. The Köppen-Geiger climate classification is Dwa. The mean yearly temperature recorded in Harbin is 4.6 °C | 40.4 °F, as per the available data. In a year, the rainfall is 640 mm | 25.2 inch.

The specified area is located in the northern hemisphere of our planet. The onset of summer commences towards the conclusion of June and culminates by September. The season is characterized by a sequence of months, namely: June, July, August, September. The most favored period for a visit is during the months of July, August.

Climate graph // Weather by Month Harbin

The month characterized by the lowest precipitation levels is January, exhibiting a mere 6 mm | 0.2 inch of rainfall. The month of July experiences the highest amount of precipitation, with an average value of 155 mm | 6.1 inch.

average temperature by month Harbin

On average, the month of July experiences the highest temperature with an average value of 23.1 °C | 73.6 °F. The month of January is characterized by the lowest temperatures, which have an average reading of -18.5 °C | -1.3 °F.

There is a notable fluctuation in precipitation, with 149 mm | 6 inch variance observed between the month of least rainfall and that of highest downpour. The fluctuation of temperatures over the course of a year is referred to as temperature variation.

It has been observed that August exhibits the highest relative humidity, with a percentage of 74.36. On the other hand, April experiences the lowest relative humidity at an approximate rate of 41.89. According to the data, July is observed as the month with maximum rainy days (14.70) while January has recorded minimum rainfall during its tenure (1.73).
